review_title: Great place to start as a New Grad RN
job_title: Registered Nurse in Monterey Park, CA
pros: Great place to start as a new grad. You learn a lot! During the peak of the pandemic, we as nurses did not have to reuse the same n95 and gowns. They were also able to provide us with hospital scrubs that way we can change out of them before going home. Unionized. Starting pay is great especially for a new grad RN.
cons: Limited resources. Charting system sucks, very archaic. Lots of very old equipment. Did not offer bonuses or hazard pay during the peak of the pandemic. Unionized, however our union isn't that great. They were very hard to reach and get a hold of.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Monterey Park, CA
pros:
Community oriented patient care
Union
Pay is based on clinical years
cons:
Short staffed
Difficult and outdated charting system
Bare minimum resources

job_title: Critical Care Technician in Monterey Park, CA
pros: Great staff, 401k match, health insurance
cons: If you can work at Garfield you can work anywhere

job_title: Licensed Physical Therapist Assistant in Monterey Park, CA
pros: Management was strong and met all my needs.
cons: Nursing can be subpar. A lot of blame game instead of problem solving attitudes.

job_title: Registered Nurse%2C BSN in Monterey Park, CA
pros: I work in Garfield medical center for over 7 years , where coworkers are very nice and friendly, we work as a team to provide our patients very good care. the salary is ok if you compare to other hospital in this area
cons: the management in Garfield medical center is very bad. they change policy all the times and they just inform you of their decision and ask you to follow and never bother to ask their employees' opinion

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Monterey Park, CA
pros: Learning as you go, great department director
cons: Favoritism is a part of the cultural here.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Monterey Park, CA
pros: Friendly coworkers. Everyone willing to help out. Big on camaraderie when faced with all things nursing.
cons: Very cheap. EHR cheap, equipment cheap. Froze pay increases from unions. Wont replace computers, always rushing to discharge to admit.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Menlo Park, CA

job_title: Registered Nurse in Monterey Park, CA
pros: I love the staff on my unit. The pay is okay.
cons: The union sucks. In general we don't get near enough support from management. Nurses responsibilities are way more than at other hospitals. On that note, nurses are also blamed for everything. Too much documentation in outdated computer system that repeats the same questions multiple times.

job_title: Staff RN in Monterey Park, CA
pros: Close to home, easy commute, Large Asian population pool patient and physician, cafeteria food price for employee is reasonable, focus on infection control
cons: Lack of management, poor staffing lot of per diem registry need more time helping out registry and poor rapport with registry, unsafe environment like slippery floor and kinking cable, small nursing lounge,
